{"step_by_step_thinking": "Colorectal cancers are often due to adenomas, which are precancerous polyps. If these adenomas are not detected and removed during colonoscopy, they can potentially develop into colorectal cancer. However, not all colorectal cancers are due to missed adenomas. Some colorectal cancers can develop from other causes, such as genetic mutations or inflammatory bowel disease. Therefore, while many colorectal cancers may be due to missed adenomas, it is not the case for all colorectal cancers.", "answer_choice": "A. yes"}
